docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump discussed the threat posed by Iran with the emir of Qatar on Tuesday and also stressed the importance of resolving the rift among Gulf nations, the White House said.

headline.print_headline: Trump Discusses Iran Threat With Qatar Emir: White House
headline.main: Trump Discusses Iran Threat With Qatar Emir: White House

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump had separate phone conversations with two leaders of nations in the Persian Gulf region, discussing the ongoing disputes between Qatar and some of its Arab neighbors.

headline.print_headline: Trump Talks to Leaders of Qatar and Saudi Arabia About Feud
headline.main: Trump Talks to Leaders of Qatar and Saudi Arabia About Feud

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Tuesday that he is meeting with Defence Secretary James Mattis to discuss a proposal for the military to secure the country's border with Mexico.

headline.print_headline: Trump to Meet With Mattis to Discuss Military Protecting U.S. Border With Mexico
headline.main: Trump to Meet With Mattis to Discuss Military Protecting U.S. Border With Mexico

docs.snippet: António Guterres has appointed Michael R. Bloomberg, the former New York mayor, to be his special envoy for climate action.

headline.print_headline: Bloomberg Is Named U.N. Climate Envoy
headline.main: U.N. Chief Picks a Very Rich New Yorker (Not Named Trump) for Climate Job

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump's personal lawyer asked a federal judge on Monday to force adult film star Stormy Daniels to use arbitration to settle a dispute over an agreement to keep quiet about a sexual encounter she says she had with Trump.

headline.print_headline: Trump Attorney Seeks to Force Porn Star's Lawsuit Into Arbitration
headline.main: Trump Attorney Seeks to Force Porn Star's Lawsuit Into Arbitration

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump agreed in a National Security Council meeting this week to keep U.S. troops in Syria a little longer to defeat Islamic State but wants them out relatively soon, a senior administration official said on Wednesday.

headline.print_headline: Trump Agrees to Keep U.S. Troops in Syria a 'Little Longer,' but Wants Out
headline.main: Trump Agrees to Keep U.S. Troops in Syria a 'Little Longer,' but Wants Out

docs.snippet: The Trump administration is opening the door to a potential White House meeting between President Donald Trump and Russian President Vladimir Putin.

headline.print_headline: US Opens Door to Possible Trump-Putin White House Meeting
headline.main: US Opens Door to Possible Trump-Putin White House Meeting

docs.snippet: President Donald Trump persists in using a phony number to justify his market-shaking trade actions against China.

headline.print_headline: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Fights Trade Dispute With Phony Number
headline.main: AP FACT CHECK: Trump Fights Trade Dispute With Phony Number

docs.snippet: Ohio Republican Governor John Kasich said on Wednesday he was unlikely to challenge U.S. President Donald Trump, a fellow Republican, in the 2020 presidential election as an independent, CNN reported.

headline.print_headline: Ohio's Kasich Says Unlikely to Challenge Trump as Independent in 2020: CNN
headline.main: Ohio's Kasich Says Unlikely to Challenge Trump as Independent in 2020: CNN

docs.snippet: U.S. President Donald Trump congratulated his Egyptian counterpart, Abdel Fattah al-Sisi, on his re-election in a phone call on Monday and reaffirmed the U.S. strategic partnership with Egypt, the White House said.

headline.print_headline: Trump Congratulates Egypt's Sisi in Call, Affirms Strategic Partnership
headline.main: Trump Congratulates Egypt's Sisi in Call, Affirms Strategic Partnership
